decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The reporting centre is a high trip generating use, which fails to provide adequate parking provision for visitors, and by reason of its inappropriate out-of-town centre location, is not readily accessible by sustainable modes of transport. The use has resulted increased parking on nearby streets including the footway and created conditions prejudicial to the free-flow and safe movement of pedestrians and motorists, contrary to adopted Unitary Development Plan policies ENV-B.1.1, E.1.1, E.1.5, E.2.1 T.1.2 and T.1.4 and London Plan Policies 2A.1, 3C.1, 3C.2, 3C.3, 6A.5
Condition : 2 - The reporting centre is an unneighbourly use which has resulted in harm to the living conditions of nearby residents, by reason of increased activity and disturbance resulting from the comings and goings of visitors in this predominantly residential area, contrary to adopted Unitary Development Plan policies ENV-B.1.1,,E.1.1, E.1.5, E.2.1 T.1.2 and T.1.4 and London Plan Policies 2A.1, 3C.1, 3C.2, 3C.3, 6A.5
description: Change of use of part of ground floor to Home Office Reporting Centre
